alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued November 10 at 2:41AM CST until November 11 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...ICE STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Significant icing expected. Total snow accumulations of one to two inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to four tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northern Cook and Lake County. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 6 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest icing expected this afternoon and evening, which could impact the peak evening travel period. The Gunflint Trail could be affected by sudden icing and black ice conditions, with the heaviest ice accumulations expected inland from Lake Superior.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
